sentences: Volker Bertelmann (born 1966) is a German pianist and composer who mainly performs and records under the name Hauschka.
In 1992, Hauschka and his cousin formed the hip-hop duo God’s Favorite Dog, who became known above all for their tracks Love and Pain and Sway.
The duo split in 1995 to pursue other directions.
The first Hauschka album Substantial was released in 2004 on the Cologne label Karaoke Kalk, followed in 2005 by The Prepared Piano on the same label.
The first Hauschka album Substantial was released in 2004 on the Cologne label Karaoke Kalk, followed in 2005 by The Prepared Piano on the same label.
In 2007 Bertelmann signed a recording contract with 130701, an imprint of FatCat Records, through which his album Ferndorf was released in 2008.

sentences: Following a concert performance with the Magik*Magik Orchestra, Bertelmann decided to integrate other musical instruments into his compositions, and in January 2010 the resulting works were performed in San Francisco by an orchestra led by Minna Choi.
section: == Career == | === 2007-2010: Room to Expand, Ferndorf and Foreign Landscapes ===

sentences: Volker Bertelmann then recorded the piano tracks at Studio Zwei in Düsseldorf, and the album Foreign Landscapes was released on the 130701 label later that year.
section: == Career == | === 2007-2010: Room to Expand, Ferndorf and Foreign Landscapes ===

sentences: On his 2011 album Salon des Amateurs Bertelmann collaborated with notable musicians such as Samuli Kosminen (Múm, Edea), Jeffrey Zeigler (ex Kronos Quartet), Pekka Kusisto, The band Múm, Nik Bartsch, Henrik Schwarz and Hilary Hahn, as well as Calexico's Joey Burns and John Convertino.
section: == Career == | === 2011-2014: Salon des Amateurs, Silfra and film score beginnings ===

sentences: In May 2012 Silfra, a collaborative album with the American violinist Hilary Hahn, was released on Deutsche Grammophon.
section: == Career == | === 2011-2014: Salon des Amateurs, Silfra and film score beginnings ===

sentences: In 2012 Bertelmann wrote his first score for a feature film, entitled Glück, which was directed by Doris Dörrie.
section: == Career == | === 2011-2014: Salon des Amateurs, Silfra and film score beginnings ===

sentences: In 2015, Bertelmann was an artist-in-residence at the MDR Leipzig Radio Symphony Orchestra.
section: == Career == | === 2015 - Present: Lion, What If and commissioned works ===

sentences: He created three pieces for them, most notably his collaboration with Múm entitled ‘Drowning’, which they premiered at the Gewandhaus in Leipzig on June 27, 2015.
section: == Career == | === 2015 - Present: Lion, What If and commissioned works ===

sentences: In 2016, he was commissioned to create a piece for acclaimed cellist Nicholas Altstädt.

sentences: The piece, Lost, premiered at Viva Cello in September 2016.

sentences: In 2016, Bertelmann collaborated with Dustin O'Halloran on the score for the Oscar-nominated film Lion.
section: == Career == | === 2015 - Present: Lion, What If and commissioned works ===

sentences: In 2017, he released solo album ‘What If’ on City Slang and Temporary Residence.
section: == Career == | === 2015 - Present: Lion, What If and commissioned works ===

sentences: Bertelmann wrote two pieces for Avi Avital, called Flood and Drought, which premiered at the Schleswig-Holstein Musik Festival in July 2017.
section: == Career == | === 2015 - Present: Lion, What If and commissioned works ===

sentences: In 2018, he composed the score for the film Adrift, which is based on the true story of a sailor stranded at sea after a storm.

He began studying classical piano and continued taking lessons for the next ten years.
During the following years he was commissioned to compose music for television and sang in a number of other bands.
After a period of drifting, Bertelmann moved to Düsseldorf and started making music again, drawing on his years of classical piano training.
